E(n)-local spectra and the AHSS

Aug 26, 2019

I got back to MIT yesterday. I want to talk about an easy but seemingly important structural result. Today, I want to show that the Atiyah-Hirzebruch spectral sequence for with coefficients in any -local homotopy commutative ring spectrum collapses at a finite page. Ultimately, this degeneration takes place for the same reason as the degeneration of the Adams-Novikov spectral sequence for any -local homotopy commutative ring spectrum.

Hopkins and Ravenel show that the -local sphere is in the thick subcategory generated by the spectra for . Every -local homotopy commutative ring spectrum admits a ring map from , which induces a map of Atiyah-Hirzebruch spectral sequences. So all we need to show is that if is in the thick subcategory generated by and the -based Atiyah-Hirzebruch spectral sequence collapses, then so does the -based one. In other words, it therefore suffices to show that the property of having the Atiyah-Hirzebruch spectral sequence vanishing at a finite page is a “generic” property, i.e., is closed under the operations defining a thick subcategory.

There is a cosimplicial spectrum defined by the bar construction on . This defines a filtered spectrum given by , which defines an associated spectral sequence (the Bousfield-Kan spectral sequence) that is isomorphic from the second page onwards to the -based Atiyah-Hirzebruch spectral sequence. If is in the thick subcategory generated by , then is in the thick subcategory of generated by .

By Proposition 3 of this lecture (which is in fact an if-and-only-if statement), it suffices to show that the tower is pro-constant. In light of the above discussion, it therefore suffices to prove the following statement: let be a complete stable -category, and let denote the category of functors for which the sequence is pro-constant. Then is a thick subcategory of .

This is proved (but not stated in the same level of generality) in this paper by Hopkins-Palmieri-Smith, but we recall the proof here anyway. I’ll give another proof (which maybe works modulo silly mistakes) for below. We can reduce to the case of pro-zero objects , since if is pro-constant then the cofiber of the map is pro-zero. We need to show that if is any cofiber sequence of objects of with and in , then there is some such that the map is zero for every . Since and are both pro-zero, there are some such that the maps and are zero for every . There is a commutative diagram

Let be any map; then, by commutativity of the above diagram, the map

is zero, since any map vanishes. Therefore, it factors through . Again using commutativity, the composite

must be null, since any map is null. It follows that by setting , the map is zero for every , as desired.

Suppose that there is no such that for , so that there is which is not in . In other words, there is no element in whose image under lives in . Let .
